references.paper_title: Multi-agent game abstraction via graph attention neural network
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant to the current work because it introduces a graph attention neural network for multi-agent game abstraction, a key element in the proposed framework.

references.paper_title: Hierarchical value decomposition for effective on-demand ride-pooling
references.reason: This paper addresses the scalability challenge in multi-agent systems by proposing a hierarchical value decomposition method, which is conceptually similar to the hierarchical approach used in this work.

references.paper_title: Scalable multi-region perimeter metering control for urban networks: A multi-agent deep reinforcement learning approach
references.reason: This paper explores scalable multi-agent deep reinforcement learning for urban network control, providing a related context for the scalability issues addressed in the current work.

references.paper_title: Evolutionary population curriculum for scaling multi-agent reinforcement learning
references.reason: This work focuses on scaling multi-agent reinforcement learning using an evolutionary population curriculum, addressing a similar problem of scalability as the proposed approach.

references.paper_title: A survey on large-population systems and scalable multi-agent reinforcement learning
references.reason: This survey paper provides a comprehensive overview of large-population systems and scalable multi-agent reinforcement learning, giving valuable background and context to the current work.
